programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: The Prom Equivalency: The girls decide to re-enact their high school proms with their current partners on the roof of the apartment building.

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: The Septum Deviation: When Leonard has to have minor surgery on his nose, Sheldon is the one who seems to need sympathy. Raj is upset when his parents split up.

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: The Champagne Reflection: Sheldon and Amy record the final episode of their internet show Fun with Flags. Penny tells Bernadette how her colleagues really feel about her.

programme.title: Brooklyn Nine-Nine
programme.desc: 99: The squad go to a funeral in LA, where Holt hears that he's in the running for his dream job: NYPD Commissioner. Meanwhile, Boyle pries into Diaz's personal life.

programme.title: Brooklyn Nine-Nine
programme.desc: Game Night: Diaz begs Peralta to help her break some big news to her parents, but Mr and Mrs Diaz jump to the wrong conclusion. Meanwhile, the squad have internet problems.

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: Beyond Blunderdome: Mel Gibson hires Homer to help him rewrite his remake of Mr Smith Goes to Washington.

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: Brother's Little Helper: An experimental ADHD drug improves Bart's behaviour but makes him paranoid: is Major League Baseball using a satellite to read his thoughts?

programme.title: Married at First Sight UK
programme.desc: Brand new series: Romantic confessions are on the menu at the second dinner party, and one bride questions her marriage when she struggles to find validation from her husband.

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: The Bachelor Party Corrosion: The guys' science skills are tested when they get a flat tyre during Leonard's surprise bachelor party weekend in Mexico.

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: The 2003 Approximation: Sheldon sulks when Penny and Leonard announce that they're moving in together. Howard and Raj form a band to play at the comic book shop.

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: A Star Is Born Again: A famous and sultry movie star (guest star Marisa Tomei) swoops into town with eyes for none other than Ned Flanders, making him the envy of Springfield.

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: Mr Spritz Goes to Washington: Krusty wreaks havoc on the political system after the Simpsons help him to get elected.

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: In the Name of the Grandfather: Homer takes the family to Ireland so that Grampa can visit quaint village pub O'Flanagan's one last time.

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: The Wreck of the Relationship: Homer and Bart take part in a father-son therapy exercise on a ship. While they're away, Marge gets involved in Homer's fantasy football league.

programme.title: First Dates
programme.desc: Will a gaming nerd finally find her 'geeky James Bond'? Can an actor overcome their First Dates stage nerves? And will an ex-wild thing's tattoos wreck his chances of new love?

programme.title: Notting Hill
programme.desc: (1999) Hugh Grant and Julia Roberts star in the BAFTA-winning comedy romance about a bookshop owner who manages to get a glamorous movie star to go out with him. With Rhys Ifans.

programme.title: Tombstone
programme.desc: (1993) Western. Kurt Russell stars in the story of legendary Wild West lawman Wyatt Earp told through the medium of the moustache. With Val Kilmer as 'Doc' Holliday and Charlton Heston.

programme.title: On the Come Up
programme.desc: (2022) Jamila Gray stars as Lil' Law'- a struggling young rapper who wants to make her fortune to help her family in director Sanaa Lathan's hip-hop-battling-coming-of-fame drama.

programme.title: Climax
programme.desc: (2018) Hallucinogenic thriller. Dancers gather in a deserted building. But the sangria's spiked. In French/subs.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: Teleshopping.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: Teleshopping.

programme.title: Payroll
programme.desc: (1961) British crime thriller starring Billie Whitelaw. When Jackie's husband - an armoured van driver - is killed in a heist, she vows to unmask those responsible and take her revenge.

programme.title: Three Hours to Kill
programme.desc: (1954) Western starring Dana Andrews. A man falsely accused of murder gets a last-minute reprieve from the lynch mob so he can track down the real culprit.

programme.title: Rio Grande
programme.desc: (1950) Western. John Wayne plays the commander of a Texan fort at which his ex-wife (Maureen O'Hara) pitches up. Can he win back her love by saving kidnapped children from Apache raiders?

programme.title: Ten Tall Men
programme.desc: (1951) Comedy adventure. Burt Lancaster stars as a Foreign Legion sergeant leading nine men on a dangerous mission to prevent a Berber attack on a North African desert fort.

programme.title: Flight of the Phoenix
programme.desc: (2004) Drama. Dennis Quaid stars as the captain of an aircraft downed in the desert. There's no hope of rescue, unless he and the survivors can build another plane from the wreckage.

programme.title: Deadpool 2
programme.desc: (2018) Ryan Reynolds returns as the potty-mouthed, can of whup-ass-opening superhero and now he's got buddies to help him take on baddie Josh Brolin in the all-out action comedy sequel.

programme.title: Venom
programme.desc: (2018) Dark sci-fi action with Tom Hardy as Marvel's anti-hero. A reporter becomes inhabited by a ferocious extraterrestrial that has its own ideas on how to behave. With Michelle Williams.

programme.title: The Outsiders
programme.desc: (1983) Francis Ford Coppola's seminal brat pack coming-of-age crime drama with Tom Cruise, Patrick Swayze, Ralph Macchio, Matt Dillon and Rob Lowe. Two teenage tribes go to war in Tulsa.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: Teleshopping.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: Teleshopping.

programme.title: Pool of London
programme.desc: (1951) Bonar Colleano stars in this thriller, as a sailor who police think's a killer. Has he been set up? He goes on the run. Will police find him? Are his days done? #NationalPoetryDay

programme.title: Nothing But the Best
programme.desc: (1964) British comedy with Denholm Elliott and Alan Bates. Jimmy hopes to change when he and Charles become mates, as Charles teaches him how to be one of the greats. #NationalPoetryDay

programme.title: The Wrong Box
programme.desc: (1966) Comedy with a stellar cast. With dosh going to the one who dies last. Who will get the cash? As both brothers clash. Wanting their parents' money fast. #NationalPoetryDay

programme.title: The Frogmen
programme.desc: (1951) Richard Widmark stars as a frogman, whose team really aren't this frogman's fan. But when a torpedo hits the sick bay, can frogman Richard save the day? #NationalPoetryDay

programme.title: Dante's Peak
programme.desc: (1997) Volcanologist Pierce Brosnan warns a town of a coming eruption. But the locals won't evacuate; they don't want the disruption. #NationalPoetryDay

programme.title: See How They Run
programme.desc: (2022) Comic whodunnit set amid a play. A director's been killed and the body's going stiff. Can two cops solve it? With Sam Rockwell, Saoirse Ronan and Reece Shearsmith. #NationalPoetryDay

programme.title: Knives Out
programme.desc: (2019) Quirky whodunnit with Daniel Craig as Benoit Blanc, an eccentric detective. A rich man's been killed and everyone has a motive, so Benoit must be extra perceptive. #NationalPoetryDay

programme.title: Hyde Park on Hudson
programme.desc: (2012) Fact-based drama. It's 1939 and King George VI (Samuel West) and Queen Elizabeth (Olivia Colman) visit president FD Roosevelt (Bill Murray) to secure help against the Nazis.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: Teleshopping.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: Teleshopping.

programme.title: The Black Arrow
programme.desc: (1948) Historical adventure. A man (Louis Hayward) returns from the Wars of the Roses to learn from his uncle that a family friend has killed his father. But is everything as it seems?

programme.title: Gift Horse
programme.desc: (1952) War drama. Trevor Howard plays the captain of an ageing US warship, gifted to the British navy, which is chosen to lead the raid on Saint-Nazaire in 1942. With Richard Attenborough.

programme.title: Young Winston
programme.desc: (1972) Biopic charting the rise of the future PM from battered Harrow pupil to MP via military action on foreign soil. Directed by Richard Attenborough.

programme.title: The Moonraker
programme.desc: (1958) Romantic thriller. George Baker stars as a heroic Cavalier horseman, beating off the Roundhead foe as he single-handedly smuggles the country's aristocracy to safety in France.

programme.title: Daddy's Home
programme.desc: (2015) Comedy starring Mark Wahlberg, Will Ferrell and Linda Cardellini. A man's living happily with his wife and stepchildren - until the kids' biological dad swaggers back onto the scene.

programme.title: Plane
programme.desc: (2023) Action thriller starring Gerard Butler as an airline pilot who must become a one-man army after crashlanding on an island overrun by bad guys. To survive, he's gonna have to wing it.

programme.title: Once Upon a Time in Hollywood
programme.desc: (2019) Quentin Tarantino's darkly comic drama set in 60s LA, starring Leonardo DiCaprio, Brad Pitt and Margot Robbie. A failing actor's world collides with the Manson Family.
